summary: Dr. Savelsberg is an applied physicist with a background in experimental fluid dynamics. Since 2010 he has been working for the Netherlands Defence Academy, the service academy for the Netherlands Armed forces, where he specialises in guided weapons and ballistic missile defence.  His duties include teaching a course on guided weapons and supervising student projects. His research is focused on performance estimates of ballistic missile threats, using computer models and analysis of open sources, and projects on behalf of the Defence Materiel Organisation. In recent years he has published papers on ballistic missile threats from Russia, China, North Korea, Yemen and Iran.

position_groups: [{'company': {'id': 105587, 'name': 'Netherlands Defence Academy', 'logo': None, 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/netherlands-defence-academy/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Den Helder', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Netherlands Defence Academy', 'description': 'In addition to teaching prospective officers in the Dutch military, I research problems related to missile defence. As part of this research, I model the flight behaviour of ballistic missiles, use simulations to derive parameters of potential threat systems and perform simulations of intercepts. I have published papers on the European Phased Adaptive Approach and ballistic missiles from North Korea, Yemen, Iran and China.', 'title': 'Associate Professor Ballistic Missile Defense', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'company': 'Netherlands Defence Academy', 'description': 'As part of the Faculty of Military Sciences in the Sensor and Weapons Systems group, I taught (undergraduate-level) courses to officer candidates of the Dutch Military, including Dynamical Systems, Electromagnetic Waves and Missile Flight Dynamics and did research on topics related to weapons systems. This included applications of laser weapons, anti-satellite warfare and ballistic missile defence.', 'title': 'Assistant professor', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'NLD Defence Materiel Organisation', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Utrecht, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'NLD Defence Materiel Organisation', 'description': 'In an exchange between the Netherlands Defence Academy and the Above Water Weapons Technology group of the Defence Materiel Organisation (DMO), I have a part-time role in supporting their research activities.', 'title': 'Advisor Above Water Weapons Technology', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 6865, 'name': 'University of Southampton', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQEOlU_74GJ2lA/company-logo_400_400/0/1663657401240?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=aScpZzMdEa3H32bRYvqz0o3eNM5Vs-62EtcSRMKEOlU', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/university-of-southampton/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Southampton', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}}, 'company': 'University of Southampton', 'description': 'This work was done as part of larger EU-funded research project into developing a vortex cell, a novel way of preventing flow separation on the upper surfaces of thick aircraft wings. I was responsible for performing measurements on a model vortex cell using techniques such as Laser-Doppler Anemometry, Particle Image Velocimetry, MEMS wall shear measurements and Continuous Temperature Anemometry. The results were used to validate numerical simulations and were presented at international conferences. The work lead to several refereed journal papers in Experiments in Fluids and the Journal of Fluid Mechanics.', 'title': 'Post-doctoral research fellow', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 4838, 'name': 'Eindhoven University of Technology', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQG4PGSYiNG4CA/company-logo_400_400/0/1642150189320?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=N3DoxTNauqgq4Ut16o0uHUjMcyPlNKMdcMlRDP-M7E4', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/eindhoven-university-of-technology/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2000}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Eindhoven Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2000}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}}, 'company': 'Eindhoven University of Technology', 'description': 'The central question in this project was what information on sub-surface turbulence is revealed by measuring the shape of a free surface. I developed a new measurement technique to measure the surface slope, was responsible for the design of a so-called active grid used to generate turbulence in the experiments, and performed measurements using Particle Image Velocimetry and Laser Doppler Velocimetry. I also developed a mathematical description of the statistical properties of isotropic free surface distortions. The results were presented at several international conferences and lead to a number of refereed Journal publications, including in Physical Review Letters and the Journal of Fluid Mechanics.', 'title': 'PhD student', 'employment_type': None}]}]
